commit_list.repo_description: This is another tagging solution for radiant: more versatile but less to the point than the tags extension.

commit_list.message: `tag.pages_count` fails because there is not method called `pages_count`. Changed the view code to count taggings for a given tag. Also generalized the verbiage to "items" instead of "pages" since any model can be "taggable".
commit_list.repo_description: This is another tagging solution for radiant: more versatile but less to the point than the tags extension.

commit_list.message: Haml adds gratuitous spaces in the outputted code. Fixed this by pouring it all into a Ruby string. Now when you want to text select the url, you will not have a random non-breaking space to deal with.

commit_list.message: ... Commit before switching back to normal html markup. Will keep haml for the sake of sass.
Minor fixes and changes.
Re-designed interface. Biggest commit ever.
Updated gems manifest with haml gem
Gems manifest
Gems manifest
Gems manifest
Gems manifest
Fixed small bug with deleting collections from entries. Added some missing files.
UI changes, CSS fixes. Fixed adding projects via ajax. Beginning file upload feature.
Added some migrations, modified .gitignore and made some UI adjustments.
Simplifying some of the view logic. Much simplification still needed. Boooo!
Reorganized views to be more general (paving the way for some rails engine support in the future), Beginnings of "inbox mode".
Moved view files around to separate concerns.
SubdomainFu, account subdomain bug fix, implementing user auth.
Auto grow textarea when amount of text exceeds height of textarea input element. Using version 1.2.3RC of jquery.autogrow.js
Some minor UI adjustments
Hide workspace in entry if currently viewing show action for workspaces_controller

Stop collection of entry inside a workspace plus removing any corresponding tags inside the entry. If workspace is scoped by a different project, create a non-scoped workspace or create a workspace scoped under other project.
Changed `data` variables and methods to `content`. So Instead of things like `data_type` we now have `content_type`. Makes more sense.
Refactored all code in views, models and controllers to use one model per entry type. Success.
Lots of changes that I don't remember. Setting up for new `model_per_entry_type` branch.

Removed Certify (yet again because it's still super buggy). Went back with authlogic, going to roll my own account+subdomain+signup scheme with authlogic. Renamed admin_tabs.js to tabs.js. [next: Create basic "public" signup pages.]
Some more tweaks to workspace UI. [next: Try out the Certify plugin (again)]
Minor UI tweaks.
Collections are now scope to an account upon creation. Workspaces can be scoped under a project as opposed to being available to all projects. Some UI fixes.
Everything mostly switched over to jQuery. Just a few rjs files to deal with.
Removing rails-widgets cause it's heavy as hell.
Rails widgets plugin cause I'm lazy.
More updates to jrails
Updated jrails (thanks futuresinc)
Jrails plugin (as submodule)
Removed `description` field from workspaces db table.
Pulling entries into workspace views
Beginnings of workspace views

Fixed bug where if a collection was deleted, the entry would disappear with it. It should vice versa. Switched from # symbols to @ symbols (mainly because of markdown). @ symbols make more sense anyway.
Updated readme.
Added logic for workspaces. An entry can now collected based on hash tags interpolated throughout it's content. Collections are added or removed based on the existence of hash tags in the entry. Win.

Added responds_to_parent for ajax file upload feature coming soon, fleshing out the workspace feature a little bit (no UI yet). Cleaned project listing ui, added dashboard, beginnings of UI for managing users in an account. BIG FRIGGIN COMMIT HERE!
Decided to dump the Certify plugin and use Authlogic (again), borrowing some tricks from Certify in terms of code organization, small UI enhancements. [next: still need to finish user auth/admin]
Removing certify (temporarily)
Fixing .gitmodule again!
Some minor changes to .gitmodules
Certify fixes...
Reintegrating account scoping
Added the certify plugin instead of using authlogic and subdomain_accounts. Lots of UI fixes/changes throughout. Added a dashboard (blank for now) [next: really implement user auth/admin]
Removing old README
Updated README which includes explanations, etc.
Cleaned up CSS by exploding certain concerns into separate files. Added ability to add/delete projects. [next: Edit projects, finish user auth/admin]
Add projects to current account. [next: user authentication/admin]
Improved the project chooser. Ajax forces me to overcomplicate sometimes.
My sad attempt at the project chooser. Thinking I might take a note from Basecamp and Jakob Nielson on this one.

Cufon for logo text, Authlogic setup for user authentication, subdomain account implementation via Robby on Rails, beginnings of milestones feature (might axe it in lieu of project queues). [next: finish up project CRUD ui, finish up user admin/authentication]
All my glorious RJS!!! The work flow for creating, editing and deleting project entries is pretty much done. [next: add validations, implement user model, etc]
Added a show_title option to make validations easier later. Upon removing title, the `note_show_title` field is set accordingly. [next: find cleaner way to do inline JS, helpers maybe?]
Adding more forms... need a new solution for toggling optional fields.
Stringing up some more views. [next: get forms workings]
Converted everything to haml, brought over images from mockup and totally, working out view structure between projects and entries and vice-versa.
Using make_resourceful plugin, adding views and controllers.
Having issues with resource_controller... bah!!!!
Beginning the app/mockup merging. Added resource_controller plugin. cause I hate writing controller code.
Form and entry UI improvements. Preparing for transition to development.
Removed some unused files, made some solid improvements to form and entry display UI.
Form UI improvements
Styling forms and more UI tweaks entry items
Background images for type labels, lots of new UI juice on project entries.
UI updates to create ribbon buttons and project details header
Mockups
Beginnings of the design
first commit

Ruby on Rails Tutorial (a practice in practice)

jRails is a drop-in jQuery replacement for Prototype/script.aculo.us on Rails. Using jRails, you can get all of the same default Rails helpers for javascript functionality using the lighter jQuery library.
A new attempt at doing Content Management in Ruby right.
Radiant extension for managing assets and images with the Paperclip plugin
It's an extension for Radiant CMS. It allows for a page to be copied (or moved) under a new parent.
An extension that lets you add custom fields to a Radiant page.
